page.title: 03TRANSPORT SYSTEMS IN RHOOSE
page.content: The Railway runs parallel with the coastline and the B4265 in this area. To the East another alteration was made to the road system when {Cardiff {Wales Airport}(known to the locals as Rhoose Airport!),extended its runway to allow wide-bodied jets to land.The resultant road loop around the airport has made for a fairly dangerous stretch of road (There have been a number of very bad accidents on the bend around the airport - two of which cost three lives). It is also fairly unnerving to have a jet aircraft fly over your head at about 40m, as the group carrying out this survey found out!! Cardiff-Wales Airport is owned by the rate-payers of S.Glamorgan. It has been substantially developed during the '70's and '80's. (Cont.)
